greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum_{d|n, d = 0, 1, or 5 mod 6} d.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Define a(n) = 0 for n < 1. Then a(n) = e(n) + a(n-1) + a(n-5) - a(n-8) - a(n-16) + + - -, where [1, 5, 8, 16, ...] is the sequence of generalized octagonal numbers A001082, and e(n) = (-1)^(m+1)*n if n is a generalized octagonal number of the form m*(3*m+-2); otherwise e(n) = 0. Examples of this recurrence are given below. (End)
mathematica: Table[Sum[If[Mod[d, 6] <2 || Mod[d, 6]==5, d, 0], {d, Divisors[n]}], {n, 80}] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 25 2017
